availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Sylvester Johnson (Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Eliza Anne Groves on January 17, 1848 in Caldwell County, Kentucky. Father of Louisiana “Lucy” Johnson, Susan Johnson, James Johnson, and Martha Johnson. Physician in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Fredonia in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Fredonia in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 824.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 211B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film 000851644, p. 268.
